author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu āvāsassa bahūpakāro hoti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is very helpful to the monastery.

segments.pli: Sīlavā hoti … pe … samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
segments.en: They’re ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, and accomplished in appropriate behavior and means of collecting alms. Seeing danger in the slightest flaw, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.

They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s totally full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reciting them, mentally scrutinizing them, and understanding them with right view.
They repair what is decayed and damaged.

segments.pli: mahā kho pana bhikkhusaṅgho abhikkanto nānāverajjakā bhikkhū gihīnaṃ upasaṅkamitvā āroceti:
segments.en: When a large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad, they go to the lay people and announce:

segments.pli: ‘mahā kho, āvuso, bhikkhusaṅgho abhikkanto nānāverajjakā bhikkhū, karotha puññāni, samayo puññāni kātun’ti;
segments.en: ‘A large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad. Make merit! Now is the time to make merit!’

segments.pli: catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
segments.en: They get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu āvāsassa bahūpakāro hotī”ti.
segments.en: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is very helpful to the monastery.”
